graphanalysis

Class BellmanFord

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphanalysis.BellmanFord

  • public class BellmanFord
extends java.lang.Object
    Bellman-Ford algorithm that computes shortest or longest paths from a single source vertex to other vertices in a weighted graph. Algorithm taken from wikipedia.
    Author:
    Pranav Tendulkar
    See Also:
    Wikipedia

    • Constructor Detail

      • BellmanFord

        public BellmanFord(Graph inputGraph,
           java.util.HashMap<Channel,java.lang.String> edgQty)
        Initialize Bellman-Ford algorithm object.
        Parameters:
        inputGraph - Input Graph on which distances are to be calculated
        edgQty - Weight for each channel in the graph

    • Method Detail

      • initializeGraph

        private void initializeGraph(Actor srcActor,
                   boolean longestPath)
        Initialize the edge quantities and distances between actors.
        Parameters:
        srcActor - Starting actor
        longestPath - longest(=true) / shortest(=false) path to calculate

      • relaxEdges

        private void relaxEdges()
        Relax all the edges

      • checkForNegativeWeightCycles

        private void checkForNegativeWeightCycles()
        Check for Negative weight cycles. If the graph has it, then this algorithm will not work.

      • printSolutions

        public void printSolutions(Actor srcActr)
        Print final solutions.
        Parameters:
        srcActr - starting actor.

      • hasPath

        private boolean hasPath(Actor srcActr,
              Actor dstActr)
        Check if path exists between two actors
        Parameters:
        srcActr - starting actor of the path
        dstActr - ending actor of the path
        Returns:
        true if path exists, false otherwise

      • getPath

        private java.util.Stack<Actor> getPath(Actor srcActr,
                             Actor dstActr)
        Get the path between two actors.
        Parameters:
        srcActr - starting actor of the path
        dstActr - ending actor of the path
        Returns:
        stack of actors, where each actor represents a hop

      • searchPath

        public java.util.Stack<Actor> searchPath(Actor srcActr,
                                Actor dstActr,
                                boolean longestPath)
        Search for a shortest or longest path between two actors.
        Parameters:
        srcActr - Starting actor of the path
        dstActr - Ending actor of the path
        longestPath - true to calculate longest path, false to calculate shortest
        Returns:
        A stack of actors which represents hops for the path
